title: Drawing, "Two sketches for a sepulchral monument", 1820–35
markings:
Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
Watermark: circle with bird upon triple mount: on top a small slope? (RB'45)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description:
Obverse: A pedestal stands upon a podium in whose middle are steps. A sarcophagus is in front of the central part of the pedestal. Upon the pedestal stands a group, as also in 1901-39-1366. 
Reverse: A rough sketch of a pedestal on top of steps with a crown and and a cross on top. In front of the pedestal is the sarcophagus with some of the figures aound it. Two candelabra are at the corners in front, compare with 1901-04-1366.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Two sketches for a sepulchral monument", 1820–35.
1820–35. Pen and brown ink, graphite. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-244.
